p: The anomalous meridional temperature gradient associated with the fingerprint ( Fig. 1d) is characterized by a large positive peak in the mid-latitude zone of 50â€“65N, which, via thermal wind, implies a more-pronounced minimum in the zonal mean zonal wind and thus promotes the formation of a double jet. More poleward (i.e. beyond 65N) the reduction in the temperature gradient (and thus a stronger negative gradient) implies stronger westerlies in sub-polar regions. These are precisely the conditions that Pethoukov et al. 1 identify as QRA-favorable.
